text.p: Michaniki construction told its shareholders on Saturday that its 1996 dividend per share is expected to be 150 drachmas, up 30.4 percent from 115 in 1995.
"The company is thinking of distributing 150 drachmas in dividend per share, for both common and preferred shares," said Michaniki's Chairman, Prodromos Emfietzoglou.

Its uncompleted project backlog amounts to 140 billion drachmas. Of these, 40 billion drachmas are related to public sector projects while the remaining 100 billion relate to BOT projects and real estate investments, he added.

At the extraordinary shareholders meeting to be held on April 17 at the company's headquarters in Maroussi, Michaniki will announce a share capital increase and the issuance of bonus shares, its CFO Akis Drakatos told Reuters.

"Proceeds of the rights issue are expected to be between 10 and 12 billion drachmas. HSBC Investment Bank will be the investment placement agent and Midland Bank will be the financial advisor," said Drakatos. --Margarita Sotiropoulou, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
